channel.title: Javascript error for my class if you can code please help
channel.description:
<html> <head><title>Chapter 2 Extra Credit</title></head> var first_name="kyle"; var last_name="****"; <body text="blue" font type="sans serif"> <h12> <script type= "text/javascript"> document.write("+first_name+" "+last_name+"); </script> </body> </html>
Why wont this work??? If you can help I would greatly appreciate it.

item.title: Javascript error for my class if you can code please help

Well I appreciate the help guys and this was like my second lesson at UCF.

item.title: Javascript error for my class if you can code please help
item.dc:creator: @tigerclan tigerclan
item.description:
@tigerclan wrote:

RSCShadow:

You shouldn’t be using document.write at all.

That’s usually true, but it’s fine for this scenario. And I was just showing and explaining to him how to fix his existing code.

Read full topic

item.title: Javascript error for my class if you can code please help
item.dc:creator: @tigerclan tigerclan
item.description:
@tigerclan wrote:

[quote=“kyler887, post:1, topic:520292”]

Chapter 2 Extra Credit var first_name="kyle"; var last_name="****";

Why wont this work??? If you can help I would greatly appreciate it.[/quote]

Yeah there’s a lot of issues here. First the reason it won’t work is because your variables aren’t declared within a script and because your strings aren’t correctly concatenated. Also you should declare your styles inside of a stylesheet, instead of within your markup. Here’s a working version.

<!DOCTYPE html>
<html>
        <head>
                <title>Chapter 2 Extra Credit</title>
                <style>
                        body {
                                color: #0000ff;
                                font-family: sans-serif;
                        }
                </style>
        </head>
        <body>
                <script>
                        var firstName = 'John';
                        var lastName = 'Smith';
                        
                        document.write('First: ' + firstName + '<br>' + 'Last: ' + lastName);
                </script>     
        </body>
</html>

also…

RSCShadow:

Oh man… If this is for a class then your teacher definitely isn’t doing a goob job.

^ That shit is super fucking true lol

Read full topic
item.source: Javascript error for my class if you can code please help
